info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued July 24 at 11:01PM EDT until July 25 at 5:00PM EDT by NWS Grand Rapids
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...High wave action, strong currents, and dangerous swimming conditions expected. Piers may be heavily swamped by waves. * WHERE...Mason, Oceana, Ottawa, Allegan, Van Buren and Muskegon counties. * WHEN...Through Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Northwest to north winds will increase to 15 to 25 knots tonight into Monday. Waves will reach the 3 to 5 foot range tonight into Monday. North sides of north piers will be dangerous places to swim on Monday as the piers will intercept longshore currents sweeping down the beach resulting in strong structural currents flowing out the piers. Beaches of concern on Monday include Stearns Park in Ludington, Mears State Park in Pentwater, Muskegon State Park, Holland State Park and North Beach in South Haven.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water to avoid hazardous swimming conditions and do not venture out on piers. Please check with your local authorities on potential beach closures.
